The six warm-hearted qualities that make: Consistently treating spiritual companions with bodily kindness, both in public and in private
Consistently treating spiritual companions with verbal kindness
Consistently treating spiritual companions with mental kindness
Sharing without reservation any material possessions gained by legitimate means, even the food placed in the alms-bowl, using them in common with ethical spiritual companions
Living according to the precepts shared with spiritual companions, both in public and in private
Living according to the view shared with spiritual companions, both in public and in private
The qualities that make for fondness and: Consistently treating spiritual companions with bodily kindness, both in public and in private
Consistently treating spiritual companions with verbal kindness
Consistently treating spiritual companions with mental kindness
Sharing without reservation any material possessions gained by legitimate means, even the food placed in the alms-bowl, using them in common with ethical spiritual companions
Living according to the view shared with spiritual companions, both in public and in private
